question: Tahqiq-i-Hind was written by which of the following authors?
explanation: The acclaimed Arab scholar and scientist Alberuni was proficient in both Arabic and Persian. Â He has been variously called the "founder of Indology", "Father of Comparative Religion", "Father of modern geodesy", and the first anthropologist. He wrote the Tahqiq-i-Hind in the eleventh century.
